sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
In the figure given below, it is given that \(FG \parallel DE \). If the area of triangle CFG is 36 cm\(^2\), area of trapezium FDEG is 220 cm\(^2\), and it is also given that \(DE = 18 \) cm, then find the length of FG .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "$$\text{ 
Since it is given that $FG \parallel DE $, we can write that}$$
\[
	\angle \input[s1v1]{}\input[s1v2]{}\input[s1v3]{} = \angle CDE 
\]
\[
	\angle CGF = \angle CED 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "
So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta \input[s2v1]{}\input[s2v2]{}\input[s2v3]{} \sim \Delta CDE 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 4, "step_txt": "
We can write that
\[
	\textrm{area of } \Delta CDE = \textrm{area of } \Delta \input[s3v1]{}\input[s3v2]{}\input[s3v3]{} + \textrm{area of trapezium } FDEG 
\]
\[
	= 36 + 220 = \input[s3v4]{} \textrm{ cm}^2
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
Now, we can write
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta CFG }{\textrm{area of }\Delta CDE } = \frac{\input[s4v1]{}\input[s4v2]{} ^2 }{DE ^2}
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{36 }{256 } = \left(\frac{FG }{DE }\right)^2
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow \frac{FG }{DE } = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} }{16.0 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow FG = 18 \times \frac{6.0 }{16.0 }
\]
\[
	\Rightarrow FG = \input[s5v2]{} \textrm{ cm}
\]
\newline

"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["C", "F", "G"], "text": "$$\text{Since, $FG \parallel DE $, therefore, $\angle CFG = \angle CDE$, and $\angle CGF = \angle CED$, as corresponding angles for parallel lines are equal.}$$"}, {"data": ["C", "F", "G"], "text": "$$\text{Due to angle-angle similarity, we can write $\Delta CFG \sim \Delta CDE$}$$"}, {"data": ["C", "F", "G", 256], "text": "$${$\textrm{area of } \Delta CDE = \textrm{area of } \Delta CFG + \textrm{area of trapezium } FDEG$, as in the figure), and putting corresponding values, we get
	$\textrm{area of } \Delta CDE = \textrm{area of } \Delta CFG + \textrm{area of trapezium } FDEG = 256 \textrm{ cm}^2$ }$$"}, {"data": ["F", "G"], "text": "$$\text{Since, the ratio of the area of similar tiangles is equal to the raio of the square of the corresponding sides, therefore, $\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta CFG }{\textrm{area of }\Delta CDE } = \frac{FG ^2 }{DE ^2}$}$$ "}, {"data": [6.0, 6.75], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification, we get $FG = 6.75 \textrm{ cm}$}$$"}]
